40 Josh Fuller

Position Forward

Height 6-6

Weight 220

Class Redshirt Senior

Hometown Rexburg, Idaho

Highschool Madison HS

Bio

Stats

Historical

Biography

At Dixie State 2015-16 (Junior): Was a 2015-16 All-PacWest Honorable Mention selection ... started in all 27 games last year and scored in double figures in 17 of those starts ... averaged 12.0 points and 6.0 rebounds a game ... shot 56.9 percent (123-of-216) from the floor and 68.2 percent from the foul line ... led DSU in scoring five times, including a career-high 29 points on 10-of-16 shooting in the win over California Baptist (2/6) ... also scored 25 points at BYU-Hawai’i (1/26) and at home vs. Azusa Pacific (12/19) ... posted his lone double-double of the year with 14 points and 12 rebounds in a road win at Point Loma (12/5) and led the team in rebounding four times ... earned academic all-PacWest honors.

At Dixie State 2014-15 (Sophomore): Sat out the season as a redshirt after transferring from Weber State.

At Weber State 2013-14 (Freshman): Played in 11 games for the Wildcats ... posted a double-double with 10 points and 10 rebounds vs. Saint Katherine’s ... was part of the Wildcats’ Big Sky Conference championship team that played in the NCAA Tournament ... was on the Dean’s List (4.0 GPA).

At Madison High School: Earned three varsity letters in basketball for the Bobcats ... was a two-time first team all-state selection in 2009 and 2010 ... named Gatorade Player of the Year in 2009 and region MVP in 2010 ... helped lead MHS to a 2009 state runner-up finish, where he averaged 17.0 points and 6.0 rebounds and was named tournament MVP ... averaged 20.0 points and 7.0 rebounds as a senior ... also attended Highland (ID) High School as a freshman.

Personal: Born in Pocatello, Idaho … parents are David and Amber Fuller ... wife’s name is Whitney ... father David played collegiately at Yavapai College and Idaho State … also recruited by Southern Utah, Utah Valley, San Diego and Idaho State ... sat out as a redshirt at the University of Utah in 2010-11 ... currently majoring in accounting.

Why I chose Dixie State: "I chose Dixie State because I loved learning about the tradition behind the basketball program when I was recruited here. I came to have the chance to contend for a PacWest title my last two years of college and to have the chance to be a part of DSU’s rich basketball history.”
